A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

About the Company
LiquiLoans (LL) is an RBI-registered NBFC. The LL platform provides consumer loans and has established a strong value proposition in the digital lending space.
It is a well-capitalized NBFC-P2P with a vision to build an easy-to-use financial platform serving millions of customers in India. The company is founded by entrepreneurs who have previously co-founded a successful rental platform "RentoMojo''. LiquiLoans is funded by Matrix Partners and Cred.
Our goal is to allow borrowers to get loans at interest rates cheaper than a bank and enable every lender to give loans to creditworthy individuals in a safe and legal manner. We intend to build a dynamic, completely tech-enabled, loan exchange platform where individuals can lend money to other individuals within minutes. We plan to integrate the new age of data-driven lending strategies and develop an end- to-end, easy-to-use online spread of financial products and services.

About the Data Engineer position:
As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing and developing robust, scalable data solutions. You will be responsible for designing and managing ETL pipelines, ensuring the high-quality ingestion and transformation of large volumes of data.
You should know how to analyze system requirements and implement migration methods for existing data. Good knowledge of ETL/ELT pipelines and database management and tools is also required, as well as experience with SQL (Postgres) and NoSQL Databases.
Data Engineer responsibilities are:
Design, construct, install, test, and maintain highly scalable data pipelines.
Develop and implement ETL processes, reports, and queries in support of business analytics.

Data Engineering Professional
Job Req ID: 18122
Posting Date: 29 Jun 2023
Function: Data & AI
Location: RMZ Ecoworld, Devarabeesanahal, Bengaluru, India
Salary: competitive
Key Responsibilities
Data architecture and design: Collaborate with stakeholders, including data scientists, analysts, and business teams, to understand data requirements and translate them into robust data architectures. Design scalable and efficient data models, schemas, and database structures to support data storage, retrieval, and processing needs.
Cloud infrastructure management: Utilize your expertise in cloud platforms (such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) to design, implement, and manage our cloud-based data infrastructure. Set up and configure cloud services, including data storage, compute instances, networking, and security, to support data processing and analysis requirements.
Data pipeline development: Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines and ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our cloud-based data warehouse. Optimize data ingestion and processing for efficiency and scalability, ensuring the timely availability of high-quality data for analytics and reporting.
Data quality and governance: Establish data quality standards, validation rules, and data cleansing techniques to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and completeness of our data. Implement data governance frameworks and practices to ensure compliance with privacy regulations and maintain data integrity and security.
Performance optimization and monitoring: Identify performance bottlenecks in data processing and storage, and optimize data workflows, queries, and indexing strategies for improved performance. Monitor system health, data pipelines, and database performance using monitoring tools, and implement proactive measures to ensure high availability and reliability.
Data integration and API development: Integrate data from various internal and external sources, including databases, APIs, and third-party systems. Develop and maintain APIs to enable seamless data access and consumption by other applications and systems, ensuring data interoperability and consistency.
Collaboration and knowledge sharing: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and software engineers, to understand their data needs and provide data engineering solutions. Share your expertise and best practices with the team, and contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering processes and technologies.

About the Company
Clarifai is a leading, full-lifecycle deep learning AI platform for computer vision, natural language processing, LLM's and audio recognition. We help organizations transform unstructured images, video, text, and audio data into structured data at a significantly faster and more accurate rate than humans would be able to do on their own. Founded in 2013 by Matt Zeiler, Ph.D. Clarifai has been a market leader in AI since winning the top five places in image classification at the 2013 ImageNet Challenge. Clarifai continues to grow with employees remotely based throughout the United States, Canada, Argentina, India and Estonia.
We have raised $100M in funding to date, with $60M coming from our most recent Series C, and are backed by industry leaders like Menlo Ventures, Union Square Ventures, Lux Capital, New Enterprise Associates, LDV Capital, Corazon Capital, Google Ventures, NVIDIA, Qualcomm and Osage.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

Data Analysis and Modeling:Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives and define project goals.

Conduct feature engineering, dimensionality reduction, and model selection to optimize performance.

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

Our engineers continue to innovate using new technologies to help save patients.

RamSoft, is headquartered in Toronto, Canada. We are also present in USA, India, South Africa and Vietnam. RamSoft India's office is located in Bangalore.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!

• Ability to develop value-creating strategies and models that enable clients to innovate, drive growth and increase their business profitability • Good knowledge on software configuration management systems • Awareness of latest technologies and Industry trends • Logical thinking and problem solving skills along with an ability to collaborate • Understanding of the financial processes for various types of projects and the various pricing models available • Ability to assess the current processes, identify improvement areas and suggest the technology solutions • One or two industry domain knowledge • Client Interfacing skills • Project and Team management

Within our dedicated Data Science organization, a subgroup of the Audit Transformation group, we continue that journey enabling the next generation of AI-enabled solutions that usher in a future that completely transforms the way our practitioners perform their audit work, and the insights we can provide to our clients.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

Position: Data Scientist Location: India, Remote Duration: Full-time

Data Scientists experienced in collaboration with product design and engineering teams to develop an understanding of needs. We are seeking an experienced data scientist to deliver insights on a daily basis. The ideal candidate will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and an inventive mind. While mining, interpreting, and cleaning our data, this person will be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the data’s full potential. As part of a team of specialists, the data scientist will “slice and dice” data using various methods and create new visions for the future.
Responsibilities of a Data Scientist:
Serve as lead data strategist to identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through our product capabilities, and work closely with the engineering team in the development of data products.

If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

The Team
Deloitte’s Audit and Assurance business embraces the promise of artificial intelligence and machine learning, with various forms of AI and ML embedded in the audit technology solutions currently used by our 10,000+ practitioners today. Within our dedicated Data Science organization, a subgroup of the Audit Transformation group, we continue that journey enabling the next generation of AI-enabled solutions that usher in a future that completely transforms the way our practitioners perform their audit work, and the insights we can provide to our clients.
The Data Science group consists of a blend of auditors and data scientists working hand-in-hand to capitalize on our world-class data assets and ideate, design, develop, deploy, and manage AI and ML solutions that can be integrated into our existing Omnia ecosystem to increase the quality of our audits, and automate mechanical processes. Qualification Required: B.Tech/B.E. (Any Specialization)
A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

Experience - 3-14 Years

Qualification Required: B.Tech/B.E. (Any Specialization)
A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

We are seeking a highly qualified candidate who meets the following requirements:
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Electric Engineering (or equivalent experience)
Minimum of 3+ years of relevant experience as a Deep Learning Engineer
Proficiency in building multi-tasking perception models based on deep learning at the production level for at least 3+ years
Expertise in cross-attention, GAN, and advanced deep learning architectures such as the Voxel/BEV grid-based feature
Basic knowledge of Multiview geometry, traditional computer vision, and 3D computer vision
Hands-on experience in deploying models on Edge devices and limited computational resources, such as Nvidia Jetson or similar platforms

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

We are seeking a highly qualified candidate who meets the following requirements:
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Electric Engineering (or equivalent experience)
Minimum of 3+ years of relevant experience as a Deep Learning Engineer
Proficiency in building multi-tasking perception models based on deep learning at the production level for at least 3+ years
Expertise in cross-attention, GAN, and advanced deep learning architectures such as the Voxel/BEV grid-based feature
Basic knowledge of Multiview geometry, traditional computer vision, and 3D computer vision
Hands-on experience in deploying models on Edge devices and limited computational resources, such as Nvidia Jetson or similar platforms

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

Bachelor's/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Electric Engineering (or equivalent experience)
Minimum of 3+ years of relevant experience as a Deep Learning Engineer

Expertise in cross-attention, GAN, and advanced deep learning architectures such as the Voxel/BEV grid-based feature
Basic knowledge of Multiview geometry, traditional computer vision, and 3D computer vision
Hands-on experience in deploying models on Edge devices and limited computational resources, such as Nvidia Jetson or similar platforms

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

As part of a team of specialists, the data scientist will “slice and dice” data using various methods and create new visions for the future.
Responsibilities of a Data Scientist:
Serve as lead data strategist to identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through our product capabilities, and work closely with the engineering team in the development of data products.

4-8 years of overall experience
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python programming language and its associated libraries for data manipulation and analysis
Understanding of ML algorithms, frameworks and libraries, statistical modeling, and predictive analytics techniques.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.
Proficiency in working with large datasets and implementing data preprocessing techniques (e.g., data cleaning, normalization, feature extraction).

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.

ABOUT UNILEVER:
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home, and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 3.4 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world including Surf, Dove, Lifebuoy, Ponds, Domex, Wall’s, Lakme, Lux, Hellmann’s, and Knorr. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose as Unilever is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace’.
At Unilever, we’re determined to achieve a culture where everyone can thrive, a culture where all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, and where their uniqueness is celebrated. We’re taking a holistic approach that focuses on how we can use the scale and reach of our business to have the greatest impact in our own workplace and beyond. We’ve set clear goals to eliminate any bias and discrimination in our policies and practices, accelerate diverse representation in our leadership, and remove barriers for people with disabilities. At the same time, we’re setting out to spend more with diverse businesses and increasing representation of diverse groups in our advertising. Find out more about our work with equity, diversity, and inclusion on our website.

A senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines for the organization. Some specific responsibilities for this role might include:
1. Designing and implementing data pipelines using PySpark and Databricks on Azure to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.

2. Developing and maintaining data models and data lakes to support business objectives and enable data-driven decision-making.

3. Collaborating with data scientists, data analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and identify opportunities to leverage data to solve business problems.

4. Implementing data governance, security, and compliance measures to ensure data quality and protect sensitive information.

5. Mentoring and guiding junior data engineers in the team, as well as contributing to the development of best practices and standards for data engineering.

6. Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure high-quality, scalable, and maintainable data pipelines.

7. Troubleshooting and debugging data pipelines as needed, and staying up to date with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data engineering.

Overall, a senior data engineer with Databricks, PySpark, and Azure skills is a key member of the data team, responsible for building and maintaining the infrastructure and processes that enable the organization to effectively collect, store, and analyze data.
